snippet: Some critics of the inquiry say the Federal Trade Commission should have considered harm to Google’s advertisers, not just searchers.
abstract: Critics of the Federal Trade Commission's decision to drop antitrust case against Google argue FTC erred by focusing on fairness for Google's search customers rather than companies that pay billions of dollars each year to advertise through site.
lead_paragraph: Some critics of the inquiry say the Federal Trade Commission should have considered harm to Google’s advertisers, not just searchers.

headline.seo: Google’s Rivals Say F.T.C. Antitrust Ruling Missed the Point
headline.main: Critics of Google Antitrust Ruling Fault the Focus
headline.print_headline: Critics of Google Antitrust Ruling Fault the Focus
